notes: First-generation RX-7 sports car with 12A twin-rotor Wankel rotary engine. Lightweight and affordable sports car. High difficulty modifier reflects specialized rotary engine maintenance including apex seal replacement, oil consumption monitoring, and compression testing requirements. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda RX-7 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Second-generation RX-7 with improved 13B rotary engine. Turbocharged variants available. Convertible body style added 1988. High difficulty modifier reflects specialized rotary engine maintenance and turbo complexity on turbocharged models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda RX-7 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

First-generation 626 (Capella) in North America. Available in sedan, coupe, and hatchback body styles. Some models offered with rear-wheel drive. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda Capella article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Second-generation 626 with front-wheel drive. Available in sedan, coupe, and hatchback body styles. Turbocharged engine optional on some models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda Capella article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Third-generation 626 with updated styling. Available in sedan, coupe, and hatchback body styles. Turbocharged engine optional on GT models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda Capella article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Third-generation 323 (Familia) subcompact. Sold as Mazda GLC in some North American markets until 1985, then as 323. Available in sedan and hatchback body styles. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda Familia article, December 19, 2024 revision.

First-generation MX-6 sports coupe sharing platform with 626. Available with naturally aspirated or turbocharged four-cylinder engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda MX-6 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Second-generation B-Series compact pickup truck based on Ford Ranger platform. Available in regular cab configuration. Multiple engine options including Mitsubishi 2.6L. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda B series article, December 19, 2024 revision.

First-generation MPV minivan with truck-based rear-wheel-drive platform. Optional four-wheel drive. Seating for up to seven passengers. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda MPV article, December 19, 2024 revision.

First-generation MX-5 Miata launched late 1989 as 1990 model. Revolutionary affordable sports car that revived the roadster market. Lightweight rear-wheel-drive with near 50/50 weight distribution. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda MX-5 article, December 19, 2024 revision.
